Events that occurred on 21 July.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1920 – J.R.R. Tolkien is appointed to Readership in English Language at the University of Leeds.
1938 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to A.F. Colborn.
1946 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 105.
1962 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 239a.
1965 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 273.
1967 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 296.
1996 – Actor Wolfe Morris dies.
1998 – The Royal Mail published a new set of stamps, "Magical Worlds: Classic Fantasy Books for Children" with art by Peter Malone. One of the stamps features Bilbo and Smaug.
2009 – Artist Heinz Edelmann dies.
2011 – Light Beyond All Shadow: Religious Experience in Tolkien's Work is published.
2015 – Actor Theodore Bikel dies.
2017 - J.R.R. Tolkien: Romanticist and Poet is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The funeral procession of king Théoden travels toward Edoras
